question: [File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Resurrection attack] Can an attacker delete and recreate table items rapidly to cause the is_deleted flag to flip incorrectly, resurrecting deleted data and violating application logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Version ordering] If transactions are indexed out of order, can newer CurrentTableItem entries be overwritten by older TableItem data, causing the indexed state to regress? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: CurrentTableItem] [Type confusion] The decoded_key and decoded_value fields are serde_json::Value - can attacker insert malformed JSON that gets deserialized as wrong types, causing type confusion in applications querying indexed data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [JSON injection] Can decoded_key on line 74 contain malicious JSON payloads that exploit deserialization vulnerabilities in downstream services querying the indexer database? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Value overflow] If decoded_value contains extremely large numbers or deeply nested objects, can it cause memory exhaustion or DoS when stored or queried from the database? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: TableItem] [JSON schema bypass] Since decoded_value is Option<serde_json::Value>, can attackers store arbitrary data structures that don't match the table's value_type schema, bypassing type safety? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Null value handling] When decoded_value is set to None on line 107, could this cause null pointer dereferences or unexpected behavior in applications that assume decoded_value is always present? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: CurrentTableItem] [Unicode exploitation] Can decoded_key JSON contain unicode escape sequences or control characters that break database queries or cause SQL injection when used in WHERE clauses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: TableItem] [Primary key violation] The composite primary key (transaction_version, write_set_change_index) on line 30 - can duplicate change indices in the same transaction cause constraint violations that crash the indexer? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: TableItem] [Foreign key integrity] The belongs_to(Transaction) on line 29 - if the referenced transaction doesn't exist in the database, will foreign key constraint fail and prevent table item indexing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Duplicate insertion] Can calling from_write_table_item() twice with same data cause UPSERT issues where the second call fails due to primary key conflicts? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: CurrentTableItem] [Update race condition] If two transactions modify the same table item concurrently, can the last_transaction_version end up pointing to older transaction due to race in database updates? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Orphaned entries] If CurrentTableItem is deleted but not properly updated with is_deleted=true, can this create orphaned entries that are invisible to queries but still consume database resources? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: TableMetadata] [Primary key collision] The handle field is primary key on line 44 - can multiple tables share the same handle value, causing metadata overwrites and type confusion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Race condition] If multiple indexer instances process the same WriteTableItem concurrently, can race conditions cause duplicate entries or lost updates in current_table_items? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [TOCTOU vulnerability] Between checking if table item exists and setting is_deleted=true, can another transaction recreate the item, causing the deletion to target wrong version? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: CurrentTableItem] [Non-atomic update] Are updates to last_transaction_version and decoded_value atomic? Can partial updates leave CurrentTableItem in inconsistent state visible to queries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Transaction isolation] Does the database transaction isolation level prevent dirty reads where queries see partially indexed table items with mismatched historical and current data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Concurrent deletion] Can concurrent delete operations on the same table item cause both to succeed, creating duplicate deletion records in table_items history? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Key validation] The key field on line 64 - are there length limits? Can extremely long keys cause database column overflow or performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_write_table_item()] [Handle validation] Does table_handle get validated as proper address format? Can arbitrary strings bypass address validation and corrupt the handle field? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Struct: TableMetadata] [Type string validation] The key_type and value_type fields on lines 48-49 - can attackers inject arbitrary strings that don't match Move type syntax, causing type confusion in query results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: TableMetadata::from_write_table_item()] [Missing validation] The key_type and value_type on lines 127-128 are extracted without validation - can malformed type strings cause parsing errors in applications consuming this metadata? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Key consistency] Is the key field on line 104 validated to match the decoded_key format? Can mismatches cause query confusion where string key differs from decoded JSON key? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/models/move_tables.rs] [Function: from_delete_table_item()] [Double deletion] Can deleting an already-deleted item cause issues? Does is_deleted flag prevent subsequent operations, or can deleted items be deleted multiple times causing history pollution? (Low)
